items.title: Synchrony Beats Q1 Earnings Estimates, Unveils 20% Dividend Hike
items.description: SYF's Q1 results benefit from growth in interest and fees on loans across Home & Auto and Lifestyle platforms, partly offset by rising expenses. It currently forecasts 2025 net charge-offs to be between 5.8% and 6%.

items.title: American Express price target lowered to $315 from $340 at Truist
items.description: Truist lowered the firm’s price target on American Express (AXP) to $315 from $340. The firm reduced its 2025 and 2026 EPS estimates for American Express to $15.25 and $17.50, respectively, citing heightened macroeconomic uncertainties that could put pressure on billed business and revenue growth. Truist keeps a Buy rating on the shares given its loyal high-earning core customer base and current under-valuation vs. long-term history. Published first on TheFly – the ultimate source for real-time,
